intro: Ludwigia pubescens var. brevisepala, commonly known as the short-winged Ludwigia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in clusters. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves with a slight pubescence, giving it a textured appearance. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. This variant is prized in aquatic gardens for its ornamental value and ability to provide habitat for aquatic life.
